subject_terms_3: war personalities Changi Prison 1942-1945 Japanese Occupation
physical_appearance: This is a greeting card. The card is brown in colour. The words 'Xmas Greetings 1944' is written in light white ink. There is a decorative line across the bottom of the card in orange ink. The card has a white and black string attached to the left of the card. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: A card with a new year wish from one P.O.W to another, it is inscribed with the wish “returned from active service”. The card is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945
title_text: New Year Greeting Card to  P.O.W
subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war Christmas cards
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Christmas cards New Year cards
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
